intro: Symplocos moaensis, commonly known as the Maori hongi, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, preferring well-drained soils and sunny to partially shaded conditions. Symplocos moaensis is often found in native forests and is an important component of the local ecosystem. Its fruit, which is edible, is consumed by various native birds and mammals.
